definitions.text: a detailed list of all the items in stock
the merchandise that a shop has on hand
examples: they carried a vast inventory of hardware
they stopped selling in exact sizes in order to reduce inventory

definitions.text: (accounting) the value of a firm's current assets including raw materials and work in progress and finished goods

examples: he dipped into his intellectual armory to find an answer

definitions.text: making an itemized list of merchandise or supplies on hand
examples: an inventory may be necessary to see if anything is missing
they held an inventory every month

definitions.text: make or include in an itemized record or report
examples: Inventory all books before the end of the year
